title: Task 1: Attribute the work to a specific culture or art-historical style.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not accurately attribute the work shown to the style of a specific culture.
Response does accurately attribute the work shown to the style of Republican Rome.

title: Task 2: Justify the attribution by explaining similarities with work by the same specific culture or art-historical style.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not accurately use one example of specific visual evidence to justify the attribution by describing relevant similarities between the work shown and other work of the same type in the same style.

Response accurately uses one example of specific visual evidence to justify the attribution by describing relevant similarities between the work shown and other work of the same type in the same style.

Response accurately uses two examples of specific visual evidence to justify the attribution by describing relevant similarities between the work shown and other work of the same type in the same style.

title: Task 3: Explain how the possible intent, purpose, and/or function shape the creation or meaning of a work of art.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not accurately use one example of specific contextual evidence to explain what these visual characteristics were intended to convey.
Response accurately uses one example of specific contextual evidence to explain what these visual characteristics were intended to convey.
Response accurately uses two examples of specific contextual evidence to explain what these visual characteristics were intended to convey.
